titles.title: Expressing the condemnation of the House of Representatives on the one year anniversary of ethnic violence in Kosovo that occurred on March 17 and 18, 2004, and expressing condolences to the families of individuals who were killed or injured.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Europe and Emerging Threats.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 3/17/2005--Introduced. Declares that the House of Representatives: (1) expresses condemnation of ethnic violence which occurred in Kosovo on March 17 and 18, 2004, and its deep condolences to the families of individuals who were killed or injured in last year’s violence; (2) condemns the use of ethnic violence as a form of terrorism to achieve political ends; and (3) encourages all political leaders in Kosovo and Serbia and Montenegro to renounce the use of violence and proceed with efforts to establish a secure, peaceful, multiethnic, and stable society which protects the rights of all people and those internally displaced, who have the right to return to their homes and villages.
